deck: 7 Bones and 7 Stones - The Ritual
description:
7 Bones and 7 Stones - The Ritual is an asymmetrical (1v4) multiplayer action RPG developed by RunAroundGames. The game is set in an East European realm called Vayandor, where an ancient Dark Portal has awakened and is now summoning MONSTERS. Local villagers have to band together and complete a ritual that closes the Portal and cleanses the land of evil.

One player takes the role of the powerful Monster and gets to play as one of the creatures available in the game. While for now only the Vampire is available, there will be many Monsters from the East European folklore available, such as Baba Yaga, The Strigoi, etc.

Monsters play something similar to a MOBA character with mana management, abilities and an ultimate. The goal of the Monster is to prevent the ritual from completing or to have all 4 Villagers caught at the same time.

On the other side, villagers play very differently, having no means of fighting the Monster but only tools of defending and running. And of course, they have each other. The goal of the villagers is to find 5 ritual stones and throw them into the Dark Portal. This sounds easy, but the stones are hidden inside rock Monoliths that need to be destroyed and the Dark Portal is protected by Force Shields that need to be removed before passing through with a ritual stone.

Villagers can use items they find on the map or that they forge at Altars. These items are not swords and armors but forks, garlic, etc that give villagers special powers. Villagers use these items to surprise the Monster and have a chance of surviving.
name: 7 Bones and 7 Stones - The Ritual

deck: Election Year Knockout
description:
Overview

Election Year Knockout is a boxing game in the style of the Punch-Out!! series parodying American politics. Set in an alternate reality where literally everything is solved in the boxing ring, even presidential elections, an emerging third-party candidate (controlled by the player) campaigns around the United States of America to battle prominent personalities from the two existing political parties and ascend to the presidency.

Gameplay

Assuming the part of an unnamed candidate, the player controls the action from over the shoulder. Each opponent is a puzzle box that must be unraveled using a limited move set of four punches, two dodges, a block, and a devastating haymaker attack. In doing so, the player must manage a collection of resources. Throwing punches uses stamina, but also fills a power meter. Once the power meter is full, it can be consumed to throw the haymaker.

Resource management is a game of risk and reward, and differs this game from its source of inspiration. Stamina quickly regenerates while the candidate is idling. Stamina also refills instantly when the haymaker hits its mark. If stamina depletes entirely, the candidate becomes winded and is only able to block. Blocking immediately returns the candidate to the fight and fills the stamina meter, but continued blocking consumes a small amount of power meter each time.

Both the player and the opponent have a health meter that, when drained, results in a knockdown. If a contestant cannot get back up, or if a contestant suffers three knockdowns in a single round, the match is over and a winner is declared.

Rounds are short and punctuated by a brief rest. During this time the candidate's coach, Maverick, opines with useful advice for taking down each opponent.

Advanced players learn how to successfully trade stamina for power before unleashing their most powerful attack when their opponent's guard is down. A well-timed haymaker, and even certain counter attack opportunities, will throw the opponent into a stagger. Staggered opponents can be hit multiple times at little stamina cost before they "blow out" beyond the candidate's reach and return to the fight.

Defensively, dodging an attack costs nothing (though stamina regeneration pauses) and can allow for a follow-up punch to land before the opponent can react. Blocking an attack causes no damage to the candidate, and will also put the player at a massive timing advantage. A perfectly timed block will additionally fill a large portion of the power meter.

Each opponent has a unique set of skills with which to challenge the candidate. The real challenge of each match is to discover how to overcome the opponent's defenses or exploit a weakness. Some like to brawl, while others are very defensive. All of them have at least one surprise special attack that must be avoided or punished.

Each opponent also has multiple challenges for the player to complete, ranging from routing them quickly to pulling off flashy, difficult counters and clever strategies. If the player completes all of an opponent's challenges, a harder version of that opponent is unlocked. These "EX" or "Presidential" fights come with all new gameplay, new moves to overcome, new strategies to discover, and new challenges to complete.

Controls

Election Year Knockout is designed for touch screens, but can also be played with a controller.

When using touch controls, tapping any quadrant of the screen throws a punch to that corner. Tapping high throws a jab, and tapping low throws a hook. Holding two thumbs, one on each side of the screen, holds up a block. Swiping up throws a haymaker, and swiping left or right triggers a dodge. Swiping down will also dodge to whichever side of the screen was swiped. The direction of each punch and dodge input can be very important against certain opponents.

On controller, the left and bottom face buttons throw left and right hooks. The joystick or d-pad can be used to dodge left and right. Pressing down or the right face button holds a block. Holding up modifies the punch buttons to throw jabs. The top face button throws a haymaker. High and low punches may also be controlled by the buttons and triggers, if the controller has them.

Game Modes

Campaign

Campaign mode is the primary single player game mode of Election Year Knockout. While campaigning, the player travels to different regions of the United States to gain electoral votes, but through boxing. Each region is governed by an entrenches politician from one side of the aisle or another, and winning that region secures it for the player. With each new region won, the player may add another descriptor to the candidate's party name, ultimately creating a long and absurd moniker that a national news host must dutifully announce. Once every region is secured, the player may challenge the White House to become the president.

Challenge

In Challenge mode, the player may quickly select through any opponent already cleared and review the list of challenges for that opponent. Opponents may still be re-fought from the Campaign map screen.
name: Election Year Knockout

deck: Align with a Faction, build your Squad, and battle for victory in a fast-paced, strategic RTS-MOBA experience.
description:
Overview

Super Squad is an RTS-MOBA hybrid developed by Bad Fox Studios for Windows PC. It's intended release date is Mid 2020.

Gameplay

Super Squad contains two game modes: Control and Elimination. Before entering a match, players select whether they want to play 1v1, 2v2, or 3v3, which determines the number of players on each team and whether they control 6, 3, or 2 troopers each. Both game modes involve players entering a head-to-head battle and using a team of six troopers to fight and fulfil relevant win conditions. Players directly control a single trooper and can command the rest of their units to move around the map, freely switching between them at any point during the game.

In each match, players align themselves with a Faction and build a team of six troopers out of a roster. Each trooper possesses unique stats and abilities that influence how the player uses them and aims to win a match.

Game Mode: Control

In the Control game mode, players control a team of six troopers which they must use to capture and hold down Control Points around the map. Each Squad starts with 200 Victory Points and loses points over time for each Control Point the enemy holds. The first player to reduce the enemy's Victory Points to zero wins the match.

Game Mode: Elimination

In the Elimination game mode, players control a team of six troopers which they must use to kill the enemy team. There are no respawns, so the first player to wipe out their opponent's Squad wins the round. Players compete to see who wins the best out of 5 rounds.

Factions, Maps, and Troopers

FactionMapsAvailability
MilitaryAbandoned Town, Military Base, Urban Battleground, Military ArenaBase Game
AlienMartian Town, Asteroid Colony, Mothership, Alien ArenaBase Game
PirateDock Town, Under the Sea, Underbelly, Pirate ArenaSuper Pack DLC
FantasyMedieval Town, Goblin Mine, Frosty Hallows, Fantasy ArenaSuper Pack DLC

Factions:

Each time a player enters a match, they select a Faction to play as. The difference between Factions is purely aesthetic, with no statistical or other changes that influence gameplay.

Maps:

Each time a player enters a match, they select a Map to play on. Each Faction has three unique Maps that reflect their theme for the Control game mode, and an additional Arena Map for Elimination.

Troopers:

Each time a player enters a match, they build a team of six troopers from the roster of sixteen. Troopers have different stats, abilities, and roles that - when balanced across a Squad - form a team composition.

Soldier: The Soldier is a powerful and short ranged trooper that shines during Close Quarters Combat. They can use Cluster Grenade to burst down the enemy team and Suppressive Fire to run into the heat of battle.

Heavy: The Heavy fares best on the front lines, absorbing damage and taking the brunt of any assault. They can use Reserves to boost their survivability during combat, and Charge to push enemies off objectives and hold them.

Ranger: The Ranger excels in taking out high priority targets, dishing out damage from across the map. Their Knockback Shot causes massive damage and stuns enemies, and their Hookshot lets them quickly reposition.

Leader: The Leader makes an ideal support trooper, ready to lead your squad into combat with powerful buffs. Their Battle Flag creates defensible positions which buff nearby Troopers, and Focus increases one trooper’s damage.

Medic: The Medic is a dedicated Healer that can keep your troopers alive and fighting on the battlefield. Their ‘Splosion can heal groups of allies or harm enemies, and Transfusion gifts temporary lifesteal to the target trooper.

Mechanist: The Mechanist dominates the battlefield by locking down areas and sending out huge area damage. Their Deploy Turret ability keeps enemies at bay, whilst Rain of Fire doles out damage that will make enemies burn.

Sapper: The Sapper alters the battlefield to their advantage through powerful Area Control and movement. They can block off routes with Minor Inconvenience, and help their team subvert enemy blockades with Burrow.

Hunter: The Hunter is no slouch when it comes to dealing large amounts of damage at close quarters. They can cause disarray and debuff enemies with Smoke Bomb, or use Fetch to drag enemies into vulnerable positions.

Spy: The Spy is an extremely dynamic trooper, able to heal, stun, and cause devastating damage. Their Mysterious Liquid allows them to stun enemies or heal allies, whilst Double O’s unleashes a destructive path of pain.

Tactician: The Tactician is at home on the front lines, protecting your less resilient troopers from damage. Their Overcharge ability soaks up enemy fire and throws it back, whereas Rallying Call buffs allies.

Assassin: The Assassin is specialised in single target damage and mobility, jumping in and out of the fray. Their Back Stab ability singles out high priority targets to eliminate, and Poison Grenade can clear enemies out of an area.

Scientist: The Scientist is a lifeline on the battlefield, maintaining your troopers health from the back line. Their Healing Pulse Turret keeps nearby troopers topped up on health, and Syringe Shot heals allies or harms enemies.

Electrician: The Electrician possesses shockingly powerful Area Control abilities that will leave enemies reeling. They can use Electric Turret to create damaging zones, or Electric Grenade to stun and damage groups of enemies.

Supplier: The Supplier plays a dual role, both disrupting groups of enemies and helping Troopers stay alive. Their Body Bomb wreaks havoc on clumped up enemies, whilst their Med Kit creates stations where Troopers can heal up.

Trapper: The Trapper is true to their name, laying traps to create near impenetrable barriers around the map. Their Poison Mine infects enemies with a contagious poison cloud, while their Caltrops slow and damage enemies.

Recon: The Recon is a long-range specialist, perfect for boosting team damage and decimating far off targets. Their Mark singles out an enemy to take 2x damage from friendly troopers, and Annihilate calls down a devastating air strike.
name: Super Squad

deck: A VR free roaming survival horror adventure set in a walker infested New Orleans. Players must scavenge for supplies, battle the undead, and make tough moral choices throughout the game's campaign.
description:
Overview

The Walking Dead: Saints & Sinners is a VR-only post-apocalyptic first-person survival-horror game developed and digitally published by Skydance Interactive for the PC on January 23, 2020.

Based on the comic book series The Walking Dead, Saints & Sinners puts players in the role of a survivor of the zombie apocalypse, as they roam around the flooded city of New Orleans years after the outbreak. The survivor, known to others as "The Tourist", must scavenge for supplies (and craft new ones) while getting caught up between two clashing survivor forces (The Tower, who seeks order, and The Reclaimed, who seeks freedom).

Built for VR in both standing and sitting arrangements, the game combines basic controller-based movement with motion controls for immersive hand movement.

The game is scheduled to be released later in 2020 for both the PlayStation 4 and the Oculus Quest.

deck: The upgraded PS4 version of the 2014 arcade Gundam fighter includes 183 suits.
description:
Overview

Mobile Suit Gundam Extreme Vs. Maxi Boost ON is the second Gundam VS game to be made available on PS4 since Gundam Versus. Bandai Namco confirmed that the console version will be made available in both the US and Japan. This game is an upgraded version of the 2014 title Mobile Suit Gundam Extreme VS. Full Boost that appeared in arcades and the PS3, but only in Japan. The "ON" in the title represents the newly added online functionality which allows players to play together or against each other.

Gameplay

In standard 2v2 battles, each side picks their Mobile Suit of choice and has 6000 Points to split for their entire team. Each time a unit is killed, the cost of their respawn is deducted from their team's Points. If the cost of a respawn would exceed the number of Points left, the team loses.

Most Mobile Suits have basic melee and long-range weapon attacks that use equipment as they were portrayed in their respective anime, and at least three different ways to dash around the field, either to dodge attacks or close the distance on an opponent.

In addition, the EX Burst System has been upgraded from previous games to offer a choice of three styles: In addition to Shooting and Fighting modes (for stronger long-range or melee attacks, respectively), there is a third option called Extend.
name: Mobile Suit Gundam Extreme Vs. Maxi Boost ON

deck: Death and Taxes puts players into the role of the Grim Reaper... on an office job.
description:
Death and Taxes is a Tinder-like narrative-focused puzzle and management game, where the player assumes the role of the Grim Reaper. It is expected to release on February 20, 2020 on PC, Mac and Linux and is developed by Placeholder Gameworks.

The game takes place in a fictional "alternate Earth" world, with the player being confined to Fately Towers, an office block led by Fate, the keeper of world order. The game's events take place during a period of 28 days and every day the player gets faxed a number of profiles of humans in life-threatening situations. These profiles must then be inspected and marked by the player, to either survive their plight or perish. Each day has a different set of rules, set by Fate, which players are urged to follow.

Based on the decisions the players make, they will have to solve different problems emerging in both the outside world and their office due to their actions. Balancing between humanity's well-being and the relationship with Fate is a key factor in the game's plot and gameplay.
name: Death and Taxes

deck: AST-Hero is a 2d space-shooter by Twisted BrainZ.
description:
Overview

AST-Hero: a space shooter where the player controls a small spaceship which must fight waves of enemies and collect space flowers in order to upgrade the ship’s weapons and defenses in the shop.

Gameplay

The player travels through the endless space, fights waves of enemies and two unique bosses. All enemies may drop space flowers which allows the player to cash them at the shop. The player can buy weapon and shield upgrades, ammo, luck and refill the shield in the shop.

Combat

The combat is inspired by the 1979 Asteroids hit. Each weapon has its own unique firing shape and can be upgraded to the next tier, to shoot faster or to do more damage.

Weapons & upgrades

  • Single Shot – The basic weapon of the spaceship. Fires one single projectile.
  • Double Shot – First upgrade of the single shot. It fires two parallel projectiles.
  • Triple Shot – Second upgrade of the single shot. It fires three shots in a triangle shape in front of the spaceship.
  • Quad Shot – Third upgrade of the single shot. It fires two parallel projectiles like the double shot, together with two more projectiles with a similar shape as the triple shot.
  • Missile – Powerful homing missiles that target the enemi directly.
  • Bomb – Clears the game screen from enemies and enemies’s projectiles.
  • Powerups – Two powerups are available, one with time limited infinite shield and the other is a time limited very powerful weapon.

Graphic design

Every asset is a unique creation made specifically for AST-Hero.

Audio

Game audio (voice and sound effects) are unique and tailored for the game.

Difficulty

There are 5 levels of difficulty: Easy, Normal, Hard, Very Hard and Psycho.

  • Easy: Player has more health, player gets 4 bombs and DoubleShot at start, low number of enemies, bosses have less HP, shop spawns very often.
  • Normal: Player has 3 bombs at start.
  • Hard: Player has lower health, Player has 2 bombs at start, high number of enemies, bosses have higher HP, shop spawn less often.
  • Very Hard: Player has very low health, Player has 2 bombs at start, very high number of enemies, bosses have very high HP, shop spawn is infrequent
  • Psycho: Player has ultra-low health, Player has only 1 bomb at start, ultra-high number of enemies, bosses have a huge amount of HP, shop spawn is sporadic.
name: AST-Hero

deck: The Yellow King
description:
Overview

The Yellow King is a hack-and-slash massively multiplayer game steeped in the Cthulhu Mythos created by H.P. Lovecraft. The game features a unique Infinite Dungeon adventure system, filled with NPCs pulled from Lovecraft's lore. Players can crawl through these dungeons solo, with a small group of friends, or with a guild. The Yellow King has an open Overworld which contains many smaller dungeons and places to adventure, including player vs. player arenas.

The Yellow King is available as an Early Access title from Steam. The game opened on February 5th, 2020.

Gameplay

The Game World

Players move around the Overworld and can discover entrances to smaller non-instanced Overworld dungeons, including caves, castles, and buildings. The Overworld is shared content, and is not instanced between players or groups. Open PvP is allowed in some Overworld areas, but it is entirely optional.

The major focus of the game is the instanced Infinite Dungeon system, where players can explore a seeded procedurally-generated dungeon. Each day the Infinite Dungeon is reset, and a new dungeon replaces it. A detailed leader board tracks each player and guild's progress through the Infinite Dungeons. Dungeon rooms may contain Lovecraftian-themed NPCs, breakable objects, hidden rooms, puzzles, mazes, and boss encounters.

Combat & Weapons

The Yellow King features a hack-and-slash gameplay style, with a wide variety of weapon archetypes to choose from. These archetypes include one-handed weapons and shields, dual wielded weapons, and two-handed weapons. Weapons can either be melee, ranged, or hybrid styles. All weapons have special "power" attacks which require a short "charge up" period to use.

Weapon types:

  • One-handed swords (broken, short, long)
  • Two-handed swords (greatsword, bastard sword)
  • Blunt weapons (club, heavy club)
  • Hammers (hammer, heavy hammer)
  • Spear-types (light spear, heavy spear)
  • Ranged weapons (various bows and crossbows)
  • Shields

Combat and defense is physics-based. If an attack hits a shield, damage is automatically blocked. Players can also perform dodge rolls and well-timed jumps to avoid enemy attacks.

There are no "character classes" in The Yellow King. A player's gameplay experience and abilities is tailored to his liking by which two weapon sets he or she chooses to use at any given time.

Skills

Weapons require specific skills to use. Each weapon is classified under certain types, and those skills must be trained to equip the weapon. For instance, a longsword requires the skills "one-handed weapon" and "slashing weapons" to use. Skills are upgraded by using Runestones, a common currency found as treasure in the game world.

Character Customization and Cosmetic Items

Players are given a wide number of options to use to customize the appearance of their character. Armor and clothing are entirely cosmetic, and can be purchased in the game's cosmetic store using Gold, a currency found while adventuring in the game. Cosmetic items are also found as loot drops from bosses, and given as rewards for completing challenges and achievements.
name: The Yellow King

deck: A cross between dominoes and a match three game which also teaches the Japanese alphabet.
description:
About This Game

Are you sick of educational games that are glorified pop-quizzes? Do you just want to play an awesome game and have a new real world skill at the end of it? Do you want to learn how to read Hiragana and Katakana?

Well then, Kana Quest is for you!

"But how does it work" I hear you think. Excellent question! In Japanese, each phonetic letter is called a Kana. Kana that have a shared sound will match. When all Kana in a level are connected by matches, it will be complete.

Key Features:

  • Beautiful pixel art
  • Over 300 challenging puzzle levels
  • Hiragana and Katakana included
  • Great way to learn for beginners of Japanese
  • Still a great puzzle game for people who know Japanese
  • No pop quizzes

deck: A role-playing game with rhythm combat that takes place in a digital afterlife where an AI has taken control.
description:
Overview

Nocturne: Prelude is a free rhythm RPG developed and published by Pracy Studios for release on March 3rd, 2020. It is the first chapter of the full game. Nocturne: Prelude was developed in Unity.

The story takes place in a digital afterlife where the protagonist (known by default as Karma) has woken up after dying in the real world. Discovering that thousands of years have passed since their death and the afterlife is now in ruins, they begin the search for their brother with the help of Kimothy (a child who is obsessed with ninjas and doesn't know when to stop talking) and Satoru (a human-koi fish monk who is wise and knowledgeable about the world).

Gameplay

Players explore the 2D pixel art world called Maya from a top-down perspective. They speak with non-player characters through written dialogue and collect items they find around the world. During exploration, combat is initiated as a random encounter which transitions the player to a separate combat screen.

The game features a Rhythm based combat system, which is similar to many traditional Rhythm games, though with the addition of RPG-like abilities. The player can obtain passive or active combat abilities through equipment found in the world or as rewards for defeating creatures.

The player must defeat the enemy by correctly playing notes which fall down 4 separate columns, each assigned to a different key. For each note the player misses, the enemy's next attack will be more powerful. They must reach the end of the battle without losing all their health to win the encounter.

In addition to the Rhythm based combat, there is also a non-combat Rhythm mechanic where the player must correctly play a short musical tune with high enough accuracy to progress through the story. During this event, the music columns can move around the screen or become invisible.

Note Types

Nocturne: Prelude's rhythm combat features multiple note types which have different effects during the battle.

  • Standard: Missing these notes will cause the enemy's next attack to do increased damage
  • Mines: Hitting these notes will disable the corresponding column, preventing player input for 2 seconds.
  • Critical: These electrified notes will cause the enemy's next attack to increase in damage by twice the amount of a standard note.

Abilities & Effects

Players can equip items which provide either Passive Effects or Active Abilities, in addition to increased base stats of health and armor.

  • Restore: Heals the player for every 15 perfect notes they hit.
  • Barrier: Creates a barrier which protects the player from additional damage for every 15 notes in a row they hit (combo).
  • Failsafe: Protects the player from a fatal attack.
  • Coolant: Provides immunity to the effects of the Mines.
  • Fortify (Active): Temporarily increases the player's armor for the next attack.

Beta Release

A public beta was released on January 19th 2019 that allowed players to play through the first half of Nocturne: Prelude. The beta closed on September 7th, 2019.
name: Nocturne: Prelude

deck: A new Trackmania patterned after Trackmania Nations is scheduled for release in May 2020.
description:
Trackmania was announced on February 28, 2020 at the Trackmania Grand League Finals in Lyon, France. The game will appear on PC on May 5, 2020.

It's billed as a remake of Trackmania Nations with a "fresh look and creative direction." Details at the announcement were light, but focused on the notion of rotating tournaments and seasons built directly into the game along with a daily selection of tracks for competition.

The track creator will return and will contain new surfaces and special blocks for creators to work with. The game's first live esports appearance will be at the Trackmania Zrt Cup in Paris on June 13, 2020.
name: Trackmania

deck: The Longing
description:
In the Longing, you play as a servant and must wait 400 days in a cave for the King to awaken. The time is passed in real time however you choose be it decorating your home, exploring the caves, reading real books from authors like Edgar Allen Poe, or just waiting around.

This game's story is inspired by the German Legend of Barbossa, the mountain king as well as by poet Friedrich Rückert. According to the developers, the game also takes inspiration from the following games: Clicker Heroes, Arx Fatalis, Desert Bus, Tamagotchi, and Dear Esther.
name: The Longing
